intro: Cyphostemma, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apocynaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems, often with a milky sap that can be toxic. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, clustered flowers in various colors. Cyphostemma species are native to Africa and are often found in arid or semi-arid regions. They are sometimes cultivated as ornamental plants due to their unique appearance and resilience.
